parameters: \n<Namdi>Welcome to Namdi's Food Cart! How may I help you?
\n<Namdi>Thank you for shopping at the Namdi's. Come again!
\n<Captain Lim>Arr matey! 'ave I e'er told ye about me time aboard
The Bloody Pearl? It been one beast o' a ship, I tell ye.
\n<Eson>(Ugh! This man reeks of alcohol and bad decisions.
I should probably help him get home.)
\n<Eson>Sir, I think it’s time for you to go home for
some rest. I’m happy to help you get there.
\n<Captain Lim>It be Cap’n Lim to ye! Say what,
I'll take me behind 'ome if ye 'elp me win this bet.
You e'er played with cards before?
\n<Captain Lim>Well then ye should be just fine matey,
\n<Captain Lim>Yarr, ye won't regret that decision thar matey.
Now lets go get that precious booty hahar!

\n<Eson>That’s great! Now, let me help you get home.
\n<Captain Lim>Nonsense! I got me a fortune to spend!
The Captain gave you 60G for your assistance!
\n<Captain Lim>Blimey! Ye wretched simpleton cost me a fortune!!

\n<Eson>For what? In case you weren't paying attention,
\n<Goddess of Balance>That’s none of my concern. I still helped you!

when I be rich tommara hahar!
\n<Captain Lim>Hahar, I'll never run out of me liquor ever again!
\n<Captain Lim>How am I gonna buy me liquor now?!\n

\n<Madame Poupon>And here I was thinking you were a useless

I've seen ye around here afore. Who are ye?
\n<Eson>I’m Eson. I’m actually new in town.

I don't suppose ye've come across
the hidden treasure o' Havoton, 'ave ye?
\n<Captain Lim>Arrrgh! Legend has it, the Great Ole Earl Havoton
buried it afore his death. That's what most o'

I've got t' get goin' now,
there's a large pint in that bar callin' me name.

and I’m on a mission to MILK IT OUT OF HER!

I NEED to get that name! HAHAHAAA!
\n<Eson>Okay, then. Good luck finding her, I guess...
